titles.title: To amend the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to ban activities of political action committees in elections for Federal office and to reduce the limitation on contributions to candidates by persons other than multicandidate political committees.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bill.summary: 2/3/1993--Introduced. Amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to prohibit Federal election activities by political action committees. Reduces from $1,000 to $100 the ceiling on candidate contributions by persons other than multicandidate political committees.
